title: Perf accept
custom_steps:
1.  Look up a particular event in MPV.
2. In PV, look that event up and change the start date.  Apply Changes.  Make note of the event ID.
3. In PVO Maintenance, choose Utility Functions > Run Event Acceptance
4. Choose the Supplier Code and Subagency Code (UMGV/MLB for MLB).
5. In the “Supplier Perf Code” text box, enter the event ID.
6. Click “Run Perf Accept for Entered Data”
7. Review suggested changes, check “Mark this run as reviewed” and click “Submit”.
8. After a few minutes, log in to MPV and review the event.
custom_expected: Event viewed in MPV should have a different start date after running performance.

title: Auto Perf accept
custom_test_purpose: To validate event performance completes successfully automatically when making event changes.
custom_steps:
1.  Look up a particular event in MPV.  Make note of the event description and date.
2. In PV, look that event up and change the start date.  Apply Changes.  
3. Wait about 20 minutes
8. Log back in to MPV and review the event.
custom_expected: Event viewed in MPV should have a different start date, indicating that event performance has automatically run.

title: Exchanges
custom_preconds: In MPV, purchase at least one exchange-eligible item.
custom_steps:
1.  In MPV, Select the hamburger icon then select My Tickets > Exchange.
2.  Select an event from the list that contains exchange-eligible items.  Check at least one item and click "Continue".
3.  Click "Find Eligible Events".
4.  Find an event and select a ticket to add to cart.
5.  Fill in necessary items on the checkout page and Click "Place Order" to complete the exchange.
custom_expected:
1.  Exchange should complete successfully.
2.  Exchanged out ticket(s) should no longer be in your inventory.
3.  Exchanged in ticket(s) should be in your inventory.

title: Forward
custom_test_purpose: Verify ticket can be forwarded in PVO.
custom_steps:
1.  Log in to PVO.
2.  Click on "My Ticket Inventory".
3.  Under "Ticket Action" select "Forward Tickets".
4.  Select a ticket which is forwardable, and select a friend to forward to.  Click "Continue".
5.  Type a note and click "Forward Tickets".
5.  Click "My History".
custom_expected:
1.  Ticket should successfully forward.
2.  Ticket should show as an entry in the "Forwards" tab of "My History".

title: Venue Xref (under Venue)
custom_test_purpose: Associate PV Venues to PVO venues
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, navigate to Main Toolboxes > Venue.
2.  In the "By Supplier Org Code" text field, enter a supplier org code, such as 48617.  Click 'Get All'.
3.  Select one of the items (in the case of org code 48617, select Bobcats Stadium) and click 'Edit'.
4.  At the bottom, next to 'Supplier Venue Xref info', click 'Go'.
custom_expected:
2.  Verify a list of venues is returned.
3.  Verify the edit screen comes up for the selected venue.
4.  Verify the Xref table is displayed.

title: Multi Entity Text
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, navigate to Main Toolboxes > Multi Entity Text.
2.  For each of the following sections, enter an assortment of search criteria and make sure that appropriate results are returned:
- Performance Text
- Venue Text
- Organization Text
- Supplier Text
- SubAgency Text
- Perf Group Text
- Protected Onsale Text
custom_expected: For each search, correct results should be returned.

title: GPL Subagency
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, navigate to Agencies > GPL SubAgency.
2.  In the "SubAgency Code" field, enter a search term for a set of subagencies, such as "AAB". Click the "Search" button".
3.  Select one of the SubAgencies, and click "Go".
4.  Edit a value and click "Update".
5.  Click "GPL SubAgency" on the left again and once more look up the same SubAgency.
6.  Change the modified value back to its original value, and click "Update".
custom_expected:
1.  Verify you get a dropdown with a list of the matched subagencies, and a "Go" button displayed.
2.  Verify you get a screen where you are able to edit the subagency.
3.  Verify the subagency was successfully edited (the value was changed).

title: MLB Subagency
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, navigate to Agencies > MLB SubAgency.
2.  In the "SubAgency Code" field, enter a search term for a set of subagencies, such as "UMG".  Click the "Search" button".
3.  Select one of the SubAgencies, and click "Go".
4.  Edit a value and click "Update".
5.  Click "MLB SubAgency" on the left again and once more look up the same SubAgency.
6.  Change the modified value back to its original value, and click "Update".
custom_expected:
2.  Verify you get a dropdown with a list of the matched subagencies, and a "Go" button displayed.
3.  Verify you get a screen where you are able to edit the subagency. 
5.  Verify the subagency was successfully edited (the value was changed).

title: PID Checker
custom_test_purpose: Helpful to see data PVO provides on a seat lock by pid\subagency
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, run event performance for an MLB event.
2.  The Performance Acceptance Header Review that is returned, in the first column, will show a Perf ID.  Make note of it.
3.  Click "Utility Functions > PID Checker" on the left.
4.  Enter the Performance ID in the "PID" field and "MLB" (the subagency) in the "Agency" field.  Click "Go!".
5.  Examine the Perf Data that is returned
custom_expected:
1.  PID Checker should run without errors.
2.  Perf data should match the event that was input.

title: Text
custom_test_purpose: Used to define PVO text codes and add\modify the descriptions seen in entities
custom_steps:
1.  In PVO Maintenance, click Reference Tables > Text.
2.  Click Add.  Fill in the fields to add a Text Code and click "Add".
3.  Check the list in the dropdown at the top to make sure the code you added is there.  Select it and click "Edit".
4.  Change a value and click "Update".
5.  Click Reference Tables > Text.  Check the list again, select the same item, and click "Edit".  
6.  Click "Delete" to delete the record you added.
7.  Click Reference Tables > Text to go back to the Text Codes page.
8.  In the "Search By Description" text field, enter some text, such as "Add".
custom_expected:
3.  Text code should be added successfully and show up in the list.
4.  Should get a success record "The text record is updated".
5.  Edited item should show the updated value.
6.  Text Code should be deleted.
8.  You should get a dropdown list result set matching the search criteria you entered.

title: Inventory Data AND Inventory Data Maintenance
custom_test_purpose: Used by App Services for Patron Data lookup & Cleanup
custom_steps:
Go to PVO Database, Inventory table.  
select * from inventory
fetch first 10 rows only;
Enter PVO Patron ID and Perf ID and click Go with "Patron Inventory List" selected.
Examine results.
Clear Entries.
Enter Inventory ID and click Go.  Examine results.
Click Inventory List, and do the same searches.  Examine results.
Click Inventory Data Maintenance on the left.  Perform the same search query.  Observe you get a result with fields that can be changed and an "Update Inventory" button.
Change values and click "Update Inventory".  Verify values are changed.
Change values back to their original value.
